p: In the years 1970â€“1980, scholars of popular culture and history of medicine began to record the traditional health habits of the peoples in the various countries, with an approach that tried to capture the full breadth without expressing value judgments. In this context, the notion of folk medicine has extended its meaning since the boundaries between popular traditions and scientific evidence present undeniable differences. Over time, therefore, the research has tried to find scientific evidence to validate or refute practices in the profane medical culture.
